message:
Sending & receiving emails is a pain in the neck. Mandrill is trying to solve this problem. It's very fast. The free quota is 12K/month, which is enough when you're starting. It's by MailChimp, so they know what they are doing.

Notable competing services are SendGrid & Postmark.
story: Mohammad Tayseer shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Transactional Email from MailChimp - Mandrill
caption: mandrill.com
description: Mandrill is a new way for apps to send transactional email. It runs on the delivery infrastructure that powers MailChimp.

data.message: I use SendGrid but I don't think they provide the 12K free quota
SendGrid allows you up to 200 emails/day for free, but it's not shown clearly on their pricing page :). See the orange button at the bottom. http://sendgrid.com/transactional-email/pricing
Yeah but if you have more than 200 users that you want to email concurrently ur screwed.
40K for $9.95 on SendGrid & $5.60 on Mandrill, so Mandrill is cheaper, but I believe both are cheap

Ses is the cheapest of them all, bundle it with sendy and you get a cheaper version of mailchimp in the long run.

It's worth noting though that mandrill and ses have a ramp up period. In mandrill you're never given the 12k on day one. You have "up" to 12k for free monthly but you need to reach it. They start at a ridiculously low quota until you're rates are good and you're verified as a trusted sender.

Your email opens vs unread ratio is high, your spam reports ratio is low, email opens vs click through ratio is also calculated.
